column1: #Thanksgiving brings us together to express gratitude for all of our blessings. This year we are especially grateful for frontline health care workers essential employees and everyone working to keep us safe. From my family to yours Happy Thanksgiving! https://t.co/mmLYLpAx5X

Frequent relocations transferring professional licenses and enrolling in new schools are just some of the sacrifices we ask them to make. It is our responsibility to stand by our servicemembers and those they love and I will always fight for them. May God Bless our troops!

November is Military Family Appreciation Month and I hope you'll take a moment to join me in recognizing our brave servicemembers and their families. America's military families make tremendous sacrifices in support of their loved ones who serve. https://t.co/R8AJDQaI7T

I want to wish a very Happy Birthday to my dear friend @RepDebDingell! I was honored to fight with you to secure permanent funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund this year and I know that John is looking down proudly at the work you do. God Bless you Debbie! https://t.co/CBF1fFGxXU

I want to congratulate Rico Worl for being chosen by the U.S. Postal Service to design their latest Forever Stamp. Rico has made history as the first Tlingit artist ever to design a stamp for the Postal Service. Congratulations Rico! https://t.co/wUJKQitjH1
I hope you'll join me in wishing @SeanParnellAK the 10th Governor of the great State of Alaska and my good friend a very Happy Birthday! https://t.co/7cP9wqJQuL

I want to sincerely congratulate my friend @RepNewhouse on being elected chairman of @westerncaucus for the 117th Congress! With Dan at the helm I know we’ll accomplish great things in our fight to stop federal overreach and empower Americans! https://t.co/rnZwpIFmjG

With Kevin McCarthy as @GOPLeader @SteveScalise as Whip @RepLizCheney as Conference Chair @RepMikeJohnson as Vice-Chair @USRepGaryPalmer as Policy Chair and @RepRichHudson as Secretary our @HouseGOP will win the battles we can't afford to lose next Congress. What a team! 🇺🇸
Stay safe and may God Bless Alaska and our front line workers.

We cannot hunker down forever but I sincerely believe that we will be successful in fighting COVID-19 so that we can restore our economic health in the present and secure a bright future for all Alaskans; our children and grandchildren are depending on us.

Today we received encouraging news that a second COVID-19 vaccine candidate has shown to be successful. This development represents tremendous potential but we must continue looking out for one another. Fighting the spread of this virus is crucial if we are to recover.
The economy in both Alaska and our entire nation has been devastated by this virus. This is not just a public health emergency but an economic crisis as well.
I encourage all Alaskans to continue following CDC guidelines: practice social distancing; use a mask; avoid crowds whenever possible.

This is irresponsible and I do not want any Alaskans to be scared of seeking testing or treatment out of privacy concerns. COVID-19 is a serious virus and its recent surge in our state has made this a critical moment.

Very frankly I had not felt this sick in a very long time and I am grateful to everyone who has kept me in their thoughts and prayers.  Unfortunately a lot of what you may have heard about my condition was based on speculation in the media that did not respect my privacy.

Over the weekend I was admitted to Providence Hospital for treatment and monitoring. The team at Providence did an outstanding job and their commitment to patient care is to be commended. I have been discharged and continue recovering and working from home in Alaska.

There has been much speculation in the media on my current condition and I want Alaskans to know that their Congressman is alive feeling better and on the road to recovery. As you know last week I tested positive for COVID-19.
Please join me in wishing a very Happy Birthday to @SenDanSullivan! Dan it’s an honor to fight for Alaska with you and I look forward to our work ahead next Congress. https://t.co/4cgRWSLGQT
I have tested positive for COVID-19. I am feeling strong following proper protocols working from home in Alaska and ask for privacy at this time. May God Bless Alaska.

I'm proud to join my friend @DorisMatsui as we introduce the Japanese American Confinement Education Act. This bill takes crucial steps to educate younger generations about the horrors of Japanese internment so that it will never happen again. More: https://t.co/BKxfsx0tNS

In 1988 I was proud to support the Civil Liberties Act which took crucial steps to acknowledge our nation's wrongdoing and to recommit ourselves to never letting racially-based incarceration happen again. Pictured in this thread is the original bill signing w/President Reagan.

The forced internment of our fellow citizens during WWII is one of the darkest chapters in our history. The fact that it occurred during my lifetime highlights just how fresh of a wound this is for Japanese Americans across our country. https://t.co/U8s4XWH88v

October 18-24 is #NationalTeenDriverSafetyWeek. Alaska’s geography and road systems are especially unique which creates even more hazards for young people than in the Lower 48. For tips on how to prepare your teen to be a capable safe driver click here: https://t.co/rpiLzc7znU https://t.co/FPTkWlPxap

We are virtual but my office still wants you to visit our booth! Our "booth" is a valuable resource for updates on bills affecting AK Natives and for meeting w/ my staff to get help w/ federal agencies or to share your views on policy issues. Stop by! https://t.co/1pFhCNWZzG

#2020AFN is here! Although this year's AFN looks a little different I always look forward to this wonderful opportunity to hear from dear friends and family and experience traditions cultures and diverse perspectives from across our great state. https://t.co/RLRudGxpT2

I want to thank coffee shop owner Melissa Thorsen-Broschat for updating me on their operations and for sharing her ideas to help get businesses like hers through this pandemic. By working together I am confident that we can come out of this stronger than ever.

These are unprecedented times and family owned businesses are suffering. I stopped by Highliner Coffee in Sitka to  discuss strategies for keeping the doors open maintaining employees on the payroll and ensuring that customers remain safe. https://t.co/MYcpONq720

@NBCF is an excellent resource for breast cancer education. I hope you'll take a moment to review their breast cancer resources and share them with members of your community. Click here to learn more: https://t.co/dp5mUMJ0AH

Too many families in Alaska have been affected by breast cancer. October is #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth which is not only a chance for us to remember those we've lost but an opportunity to inform ourselves about signs symptoms and strategies for early detection. https://t.co/X2NqtFsBeo

#FatBearWeek is officially upon us! Every year people from around the world watch the bears of @KatmaiNPS pack on pounds to sustain them through the winter. Who will be 2020's fattest bear? Head to the official Fat Bear Week site to fill out your bracket! https://t.co/IJnIrsX3J5 https://t.co/wJ9nNSfybJ

I was proud to serve with Mark Meadows in the House and our working relationship continues to prove beneficial in his role as White House Chief of Staff. Learn more and read the full permit signed by President Trump here: https://t.co/Pa6s64KW1L
I will continue to support A2A to its completion and will be doing everything within my power to cut through red tape and bureaucracy. I have always said that in Congress relationships are important.

The A2A project represents tremendous potential not only for our economy but for the delivery of affordable energy for American families. I have been an outspoken supporter of this project because it means good-paying jobs for Alaskans.

I have been working closely with the POTUS his Chief of Staff @MarkMeadows senior White House officials and @SenDanSullivan all year to secure this critical permit. A2A intends to begin work immediately and the project is expected to provide thousands of jobs for Alaskans.

BREAKING: At my request President @realDonaldTrump  has officially signed the Presidential Permit authorizing the construction of the Alaska to Alberta (A2A) railroad! A2A rail links Alaska to Alberta Canada with the goal of transporting oil minerals and other commodities. https://t.co/9km1N9xZEU

Supporting these programs is critical for our ability to deploy hydropower pumped storage and marine energy projects and related transmission infrastructure into low-income economically distressed underserved and rural communities. Read more here: https://t.co/V8ffG12XNX

Water power programs within the @Energy are essential for supporting renewables. The state of Alaska has tremendous hydroelectric potential and these programs provide rural and remote communities with new opportunities to obtain reliable and affordable hydropower.
🌊BIG WIN FOR AK'S RENEWABLE ENERGY FUTURE🌊  My bill the Water Power Research and Development Act has passed the House! https://t.co/wfuRw38qlh

It is my great hope that we can turn the tide in the fight against crimes perpetrated on our Native communities and it will continue to be one of my highest priorities to ensure that Alaska is a safe place for all. Read more: https://t.co/IS4eSXll71 #EndMMIW
I am very proud to have helped Savanna's Act and the Not Invisible Act get across the finish line. The bills passed this week are a significant step forward but there is still much work to be done.

All too often our Alaska Native communities have experienced the tragedy and heartbreak of the ongoing national #MMIWG crisis. As the father of two strong Alaska Native daughters combating this scourge has always been one of my highest priorities in Congress.

NEW: The House has sent two major pieces of legislation to combat the epidemic of Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls (MMIWG) to the President’s desk to be signed into law. https://t.co/lXEsqx8JtQ

I want to thank @RepDebHaaland (D-NM) for her steadfast support of this legislation and I look forward to our continued work together on behalf of our First Peoples. Read more here: https://t.co/XeMcA7h4wY
Passage of this bill marks not only a great day for bipartisan governance but represents a long-overdue victory for Alaska Natives and Indigenous people across the country.

NEW: My bill to cut red tape and empower AK Native communities is headed to @POTUS's desk to be signed! The PROGRESS for Indian Tribes Act is a critical bill that will allow tribes to tailor self-governance programs to suit their needs thereby increasing their effectiveness.

Please join me in wishing a Happy 73rd Birthday to the @usairforce! Over 14k Air Force servicemembers are stationed in Alaska and we’re grateful for everything they do to keep our skies safe and free. The Air Force is rich with history learn more here: https://t.co/ZIBrHYAtph https://t.co/ydGE7bTfYc
As a Member of the Subcommittee for Indigenous Peoples of The U.S. and Vice Chair of the Native American Caucus I will continue fighting to secure justice for our Native people. #MMIW #MMIWG
I want to thank my friend @RepNewhouse for helping to lead the charge in the fight against Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls (MMIWG).

These bills will take urgent action to stop violence against Native Americans and bring perpetrators to justice. These two pieces of legislation have already passed the Senate and we must continue pushing to bring these bipartisan bills to a vote.
This isn't just an Alaskan issue. Indigenous women and girls across the country face the same violence. I am a proud supporter of both Savannah's Act and the Not Invisible Act.

Too many AK Native communities have experienced the pain caused by the tragedy of missing and murdered AK Natives particularly women and girls. My children and grandchildren are AK Native; for them and for future generations of Indigenous children we must take urgent action. https://t.co/dnPWn2AJGG

Alaskans deserve to have their roads schools recreation areas and other public services fully funded; our field staff needs more time to complete this critical task. Read more: https://t.co/n5184lOZeT

Let me be very clear: if AK's field staff are unable to finish a thorough and accurate Census billions in federal funding will be left on the table over the next decade. We must extend the Census deadline.

One of the most important things Alaskans can do to ensure that our state is treated fairly is to fill out the Census. Our constitutionally mandated Census only happens once a decade and the COVID-19 pandemic has made this decade's Census data collection uniquely challenging.

BREAKING: I just intro'd legislation w/ my friend @RepRubenGallego to restore the #Census deadline to 10/31/20 from the 9/30/20 end date implemented in July. I am grateful to @lisamurkowski for introducing my bill in the Senate and to @SenDanSullivan for his strong support. https://t.co/6MBG06zFbT

To honor those who were lost we must always commit ourselves to the values of patriotism community and service to our fellow Americans. May God Bless the lives lost that day – and the families who still grieve. #NeverForget

Firefighters police officers paramedics and everyday citizens risked their lives for one another. Tragically many of these heroes never returned home. In the days that followed America stood together united.

19 years ago thousands of innocent lives were tragically cut short. September 11 2001 was one of America's darkest days and we must never forget the victims of this heinous evil. Many heroes stepped up that day. https://t.co/VM03iICtbs
For suicide prevention tips and to learn how to identify someone in crisis click here to learn more: https://t.co/5bYwv3PHOt #KeepGoing

The isolation caused by #COVID19 has put the tragedy of suicide in a greater spotlight. I want you to know that help is available. If you're experiencing suicidal feelings call the National Suicide Prevention Hotline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Help is available 24/7 at no cost. https://t.co/JoyRmcVHYc

Alaska's own @RuthyHebard24 continues to make our state proud! Ruthy and her team the @chicagosky are headed for the @WNBA playoffs. Ruthy I have no doubt that there are big things ahead for you. Alaska is cheering for you to win it all! Read more: https://t.co/BCS0osnn8e https://t.co/InNouBffWL

This funding will go a long way toward keeping our children and families safe. We must always promote a culture of zero-tolerance for domestic violence and I am grateful to the DOJ for recognizing the urgent need for these crucial resources. More: https://t.co/VjpQ1QG17i
𝐖𝐞 𝐜𝐚𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐝𝐨 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐯𝐢𝐨𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐚𝐠𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐬𝐭 𝐰𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐧 𝐬𝐮𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭 𝐬𝐮𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐯𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐛𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐬𝐞 𝐜𝐫𝐢𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐞.
AK often ranks first as the state with the highest rates of women killed by men and AK Native women are ten times more likely to experience domestic violence than other women in the United States.

.@TheJusticeDept has awarded $320k to the Kenaitze Tribe & $243k to the AK Network on Domestic Violence & Sexual Assault. Every year women around the nation survive rape domestic abuse and other tragic violence. Sadly these crimes are more prevalent in AK Native communities. https://t.co/93SrxFczqg

As a veteran myself I fully believe that having servicemembers and veterans serving in Congress strengthens our legislative body. I am thankful for both Rep. Gabbard's service and her long-time friendship. I am confident that she enjoyed her time in AK. Thanks for visiting!
We shared a very productive conversation on a range of topics such as our shared tourism economy and how Alaska and Hawaii can lead the way in renewable energy sources like geothermal and hydropower.
Alaska and Hawaii have a long and storied history together and although we come from different parties Tulsi has been a great partner on policies of importance to our two states.
The Arctic is a unique training environment and I am always pleased when my fellow Members of Congress get to experience our region firsthand.

Rep. Gabbard's duties brought her to our state for an Innovative Readiness Training (IRT) mission to help assess how the @DeptofDefense can better support AK Native Communities in the areas of broadband expansion the construction of roads and renewable energy development.
It was great hosting my good friend and colleague Congresswoman @TulsiGabbard at my office in Anchorage. https://t.co/bKCV3ClOBr

This week I met w/reps from the #Census in Anchorage for an AK update. While our standing has improved there is more to do to ensure AK is well represented for the next decade. Watch my message from this week’s visit below. Click here to take the Census: https://t.co/qxKVGzMUgA https://t.co/yqbCLLnZ2V

It is my great hope that we can turn the tide in the fight against crimes perpetrated in our Native communities and it will continue to be one of my highest priorities to ensure that AK is a safe place for all. Read more: https://t.co/SERsgMAf6T #MMIW #MMIWG @ASIndianAffairs
I am grateful to the @POTUS and @SecBernhardt for their commitment to Alaska Natives and Indigenous people across our country. Our work must not stop.
Very frankly I wish there was no need for this office but the sad truth is that Alaska Natives are being targeted and we must show zero tolerance for the violence being committed against them.
This office is important news for the victims and families in our state who deserve nothing short of justice.

Yesterday alongside our Congressional Delegation and Alaska's-own Assistant Secretary for Indian Affairs Tara Sweeney I was honored to help open the first Missing and Murdered Native Americans Cold Case office in Anchorage.
My children and grandchildren are Alaska Native; for them and for future generations of Indigenous children we must take urgent action to combat this crisis.

Alaska Native communities are home to some of the most remote population centers in our state. Because of the difficulty in travel and communication the scourge of missing and murdered Alaska Natives particularly women and girls has tragically impacted far too many families. https://t.co/25S6XXPOBq
My full statement following a productive call with Postmaster General DeJoy: https://t.co/zomfhkJdAo

✅NEW: Over $5 million in grants from @HHSGov is on its way to Alaska!✅   This is welcome news for the families who have come to rely on the high-quality health care delivered by our State community health centers and various tribal consortia. More: https://t.co/bimEMUaon1 https://t.co/fuFQuJiFHv

BREAKING: I just left the House Floor after casting my YES vote on the Delivering for America Act. Alaskans rely on the USPS and bypass mail to connect their communities and I'll ALWAYS stand up for the Postal Service. Hear my thoughts on today's bill⬇️ https://t.co/iSzIiLsO2o
Alaskans can count on me to always stand up for #USPS. Read my statement with @lisamurkowski and @SenDanSullivan⬇️ https://t.co/rZlTsshqKs

Had a great time discussing AK energy development strengthening our infrastructure my recent work in Congress and more w/@JeffLandfield on the @alaskalandmine podcast yesterday. I could get the hang of this! Maybe I should start my own podcast – any ideas on what we'd call it? https://t.co/zZPX8AmLPy

As we approach the day where the first drilling rigs arrive and crude starts flowing I will continue working with great excitement to ensure that Alaska is front and center as we blaze the trail toward American energy dominance.  Read more: https://t.co/zmr78zjeVu 🛢️🇺🇸

Thousands of Alaskans are employed in our oil industry and their livelihoods depend on the good-paying jobs created by our state's reserves. Today we are one step closer to securing a bright future for these Alaskans and their families.

I've long fought to realize the original promise of ANILCA which designated the 1002 Area of ANWR's Coastal Plain for responsible oil exploration. In AK we've proven that protecting the environment honoring our history and developing our natural resources can go hand-in-hand.

✅BIG NEWS on this Monday morning✅@BLMNational  has released its Record of Decision for an oil and gas program in the non-wilderness Coastal Plain of #ANWR. Today is a great day not only for Alaska but also for American energy independence. https://t.co/pYdCylnCmc

She is playing TONIGHT against the Connecticut Sun at 3 pm AK time and I encourage everyone to tune in and cheer her on. Please join me in congratulating Ruthy and her family on being drafted by the WNBA. Keep making Alaska proud Ruthy! #WNBA @chicagosky

From her days playing forward at West Valley High School in Fairbanks to being selected for the First-team All-American at the University of Oregon Ruthy has proven herself as an athlete with true Alaskan grit and determination.

Today it was my great honor to present a Congressional Record statement to the parents of @RuthyHebard24 at my office in Fairbanks. Ruthy’s career in the WNBA began in April when the Chicago Sky drafted her as their eighth overall pick. She is an incredible athletic talent. https://t.co/H6wBDUvd5S

I’m proud to be leading bipartisan legislation w/ @RepJohnYarmuth @RepDonBacon and @RepDannyDavis to combat homelessness and ensure that the health safety and resiliency of our most vulnerable citizens are protected. Read more about our bill here: https://t.co/ccM9PSW1KF
Housing not only brings improved health outcomes but it also increases upward mobility and economic certainty.

In AK and across the country COVID-19 has affected nearly every area of our lives. Some of our nation's most vulnerable populations find themselves already facing housing instability. This pandemic has only made it harder to find work and put a roof over their families' heads. https://t.co/tIe9dF5lIa
What’s your favorite way to prepare and eat Alaskan salmon?

It’s #AlaskaWildSalmonDay! Salmon is one of our most famous exports and our fishermen and processors work hard to ensure that families across the US can put our delicious salmon on their tables. AK leads the way in sustainable fishing and I’m very proud of the example we set. https://t.co/aWm7myfJD1

🚨The deadline to take the Census is Sept 30th and is fast approaching!🚨 A full and complete count is critical to helping ensure AK's success over the next decade. Taking the Census is easy and can be completed from home. Click here to take the Census: https://t.co/qxKVGzMUgA https://t.co/qW6jy0xUBG
Read my full op-ed on big bank hypocrisy in The Hill: https://t.co/ijXltslis4

Morgan Stanley Wells Fargo Chase Citigroup and Goldman Sachs announced they would not be financing any drilling. Given their terrible record on the environment and human rights why then do they continue financing drilling in China and Saudi Arabia? One word: hypocrisy.

However earlier this year bank after bank decided that the concerns of a handful of internet environmentalists outweighed the views of Alaskans and the Alaska Natives whose very livelihoods depend on oil revenue.

In 1980 President Jimmy Carter – a staunch environmentalist by any standard – designated the 10-02 area of #ANWR for energy development. For decades Alaskans including the Arctic Inupiat who live near ANWR have looked toward the promise of drilling with hope and excitement.

For decades Alaskans have been leading the way in responsible energy development. Our petroleum industry supports over 110k jobs meaning 1 in 3 Alaskans pour their efforts into balancing oil extraction with careful protection of our ecosystems.

🏔TODAY: In honor of the Great American Outdoors Act being signed into law entrance fees to National Parks will be WAIVED.🏔   ⛺️I want to thank President @realDonaldTrump for recognizing me yesterday as he signed this landmark conservation bill. Let’s get outside Alaska! ⛺️ https://t.co/9i6uDjM8Ci

I recently spoke on the House Floor in support of the Water Power Technologies Office at the Department of Energy which provides essential support for hydropower projects and expands energy infrastructure in low-income underserved and rural communities.

Our state has incredible potential for clean renewable energy – look no further than Kodiak which runs on 99% renewable energy. Hydropower is one of the next great frontiers in Alaska's energy portfolio and harnessing it will be essential for American energy independence. https://t.co/uKkrCp9Yaa

As a parent and a former schoolteacher I know how important it is to make sure that parents have the support they need to help their children thrive. Last night I helped the House pass TWO bills to help our working families get through uncertain times. https://t.co/3CwRe67Ual https://t.co/MV1hBa0PDc

.@RepFinkenauer and I recently intro'd the Unlocking Opportunities in Emerging Markets Act. This crucial bill helps rural women minority and veteran #smallbiz owners obtain capital to start and grow their businesses – in AK and across the country. More: https://t.co/eYbT6a6cjX https://t.co/nf1EyBakUU

Thank you to the Audubon Society members from Alaska who took time last week to discuss the work we're doing in Congress to boost coastal resiliency and help #SaveTheSeabirds. Read more about my bill w/ @RepDMP to help do just that: https://t.co/poyMnIuAV3 @audubonsociety https://t.co/6azsKl1bEA

#PPP has saved over 114k jobs across AK. This resource is critical to keeping our small businesses open and their workers on the payroll. The deadline to apply for PPP loans was recently extended to August 8th. Click here to learn how to apply: https://t.co/WjZ3pCMjTr #PPPWorks https://t.co/VFNgKoDNRK

As we approach the 30th Anniversary of the Americans w/Disabilities Act I'm prouder than ever to have helped get it across the finish line. Thank you @LeaderHoyer for recognizing @JimLangevin and me this AM for our work as Co-Chairs of the Bipartisan Disabilities Caucus. #ADA30 https://t.co/5013ea6IdG

Tonight I helped the House pass the Great American Outdoors Act which includes a cause I've long championed: permanent funding for the Land and Water Conservation Fund. This is the single largest federal investment in conservation in 80 years. Read more: https://t.co/XhFI0uYLdW https://t.co/uKrk6X4ktU

For many years my friend @JohnDingell and I worked to permanently fund the #LWCF. I'm proud that today alongside @RepDebDingell we finally got it done. I miss you John but I know you're looking down very proudly at what we accomplished for our great nation and its future. https://t.co/pfCzHAd083
Read more about this year's NDAA and its included provisions: https://t.co/I6gLYvmLxc

My good friend the late Senator Ted Stevens was a steadfast advocate for our great state. I am especially pleased that this year's NDAA makes essential progress to ensure that the Ted Stevens Center for Security Studies becomes a reality.

In Congress relationships are crucial; this year I worked with my colleagues on the Armed Services Committee to include my amendments which bolster health care strengthen communications in the Arctic and take action to turn the tide in the fight against military suicides.

I want America's fighting men and women to know that we have their backs. I'm proud to share that today I helped the House pass the #FY21NDAA which includes needed funding for military expenditures provides a 3.1% military pay raise and bolsters pandemic preparedness. https://t.co/9UworqE1Gx

Alaska Natives whether they live in remote corners of AK or in downtown Anchorage are all too familiar w/ public health emergencies. I'm pleased announce that over $2 mil from @HHSGov is coming to help keep our Native communities healthy. More: https://t.co/lpT7YvTH2F https://t.co/13yhuf3fXz

He represented the best of America and we’ll forever owe him our sincere gratitude. We have lost a remarkable American but I know that his life will always inspire us to lead with determination grit and grace. Please join me in keeping the entire Lewis Family in your prayers.

From marching on the front lines against racial injustice in Selma to standing up for his constituents and working to make our country a better place in Congress John never stopped fighting for what he believed in.
I had the honor and privilege of serving alongside John Lewis and witnessing his love for our great nation. https://t.co/lCf5xQSxg4

Last year I sat down with @ChrisEvans to discuss public service and bipartisanship for his new series @ASP. Chris is using his platform to entourage civic engagement and I look forward to working with him again soon. Watch and learn more here: https://t.co/AaU5GeJqna https://t.co/IjdOnWJabU

These are trying times for our country and our Native communities have felt the impact as well. It continues to be my goal to help them come out stronger than ever before. In Congress I will always stand up for our ANCs and Native villages. Thank you for a great conversation!

I want to express my sincere gratitude to @AhtnaInc for hosting me for a discussion at Klutina Culture Camp. Ahtna does vital work to ensure that their communities succeed and I appreciated our wide-ranging discussion on transportation energy costs CARES Act relief and more. https://t.co/XoI7y9q6UP

The CARES Act was crucial for supporting our economy at a time of crisis. Today I'm pleased to announce that $5.3mil in emergency funding is coming directly to AK so that our small businesses can keep their doors open and workers paid. Read more: https://t.co/bVkNjjuIrh https://t.co/P2JRRLMLOZ
I encourage you to catch up on our conversations by picking up a paper or tuning in to the radio.

Thanks to Caleb Vierkant at the Wrangell Sentinel Michelle O'Brien at KTKN John Tierney at the Copper River Record Greg Knight at KINY and Scott Yahr at KCAM for their excellent questions on energy development infrastructure economic opportunity and much more. https://t.co/IpQSUr2etn

It's been a busy swing through the Copper River Basin and Southeast! I always appreciate the opportunity to update Alaskans directly on the issues facing Congress; one of the best ways to do that is through radio and print. https://t.co/aR7fmqHtDm
Thank you to Rear Adm Bell and everyone who helped make this visit possible. God Bless our Coast Guard!

I especially appreciated the chance to meet with some of the men and women of the U.S. Coast Guard and I am proud of the work they do in our state and am proud of the role they’ll play as the Arctic’s global profile continues to grow.

America is an Arctic nation because of Alaska. As the area changes in the decades ahead we must be ready to protect America’s national security and economic interests in the region; FRCs will be central to this goal.
Countless families in our state depend on the ocean to make a living and FRCs are a critical tool for ensuring that our waters are safe and navigable.

It was my great honor to join Rear Admiral Matthew Bell aboard the USCGC Bailey Barco today in Juneau. I have been a long-time advocate of homeporting Fast Response Cutters (FRCs) like the Bailey Barco in Alaska. https://t.co/gzjxfArOPO

I want to extend my sincere congratulations to the winners and thank everyone who helped make this amazing event possible!

The House should be bringing her statehood legislation to the Floor instead of wasting time and resources on this partisan D.C. bill.

The people of Puerto Rico have voted twice in the past eight years to become a state and I continue working closely with @RepJenniffer and other advocates to help make their admission to the Union a reality.
Statehood for Puerto Rico would give it the tools resources and power necessary to get its fiscal house in order so that taxpayers are not on the hook to bail out the island.

Puerto Rico has been treated very unfairly due to its current status which is a contributing factor to its ongoing debt crisis. D.C. is doing well financially which is precisely why the need for Puerto Rican statehood is far more urgent.

The framers intended for territories to be eligible for statehood and I have long advocated for Puerto Rican statehood. I authored the only Puerto Rico statehood bill ever to pass the House and I am very proud of that.

My Democrat colleagues have dedicated a lot of time to antagonizing President Trump; it is ironic then that their flawed statehood bill would give him de-facto control of electoral votes that could swing a presidential election.
Without its repeal the smaller federal district still retains its three electoral votes effectively giving the remaining residents – the First Family – three Electoral Votes for president.
Secondly and most crucially the bill shrinks the federal district without immediately repealing the 23rd Amendment.
The bill passed out of the House today is very flawed. First and foremost the bill violates the Constitution's enclave clause which requires Congress to retain control of the federal seat of power.

THREAD: Our founders never intended for Washington D.C. to become a state. Our Nation's Capital was meant to be an independent federal district and for that reason our Capital was moved from Philadelphia to Washington D.C. in the eighteenth century.
We can and must do better.

All communities should be able to trust their local police forces and our brave law enforcement officers deserve the resources necessary to uphold equal justice in our country. The JUSTICE Act can become law and Republicans stand ready to work with our Democrat colleagues.
Honoring the memory of George Floyd requires us to deliver impactful lasting change on these issues. I want us to be successful in this endeavor.
We should not be stripping the protections and safeguards of all police officers because of the actions of a handful of bad ones; this puts the safety and security of our communities at risk.
The Democrat bill operates under the assumption that all members of law enforcement are bad and I believe that is wrong.

The bill drafted by House Democrats contains measures that could actually make us less safe and discourage community-minded individuals from pursuing careers in law enforcement and making a difference.
Frankly today’s vote on this bill is an election year stunt and does nothing to provide for the real reform that Americans are demanding.

This should be an open and transparent process that allows for debate and input but it should be noted that Republicans on the Judiciary Committee offered a dozen amendments to improve the bill and all were rejected by Democrats at every turn.

I was hopeful that my colleagues on the other side of the aisle would deliver a bill that could both offer solutions and become law but what passed the House today was overly partisan and will not make it to the President's desk.
Finally the bill makes lynching a federal crime which I have previously supported in the House. In many cases these high standards are already in practice by Alaska’s law enforcement agencies.

The JUSTICE Act also closes the so-called “consent loophole” making it unlawful for an officer to engage in a sexual act with a detained suspect something the Democrat bill surprisingly does not address.
Additionally it bans the use of choke holds provides funding for body cameras and storage for footage and expands de-escalation training for police departments.
The JUSTICE Act includes important provisions such as requiring annual reporting on the use of no-knock warrants and issuing financial penalties to police departments for failure to do so.
His bill the JUSTICE Act is a significant step forward and I'm supporting it. The reforms it implements are not only long overdue but enjoy support from advocates from both sides of the aisle.

My colleague Senator Tim Scott (R-SC) is an important voice on the issue of police reform and he has drafted legislation containing many bipartisan priorities that stand a real chance of becoming law.
Republicans and Democrats agree that reforms are needed to increase accountability and transparency and to provide solutions to police misconduct in neighborhoods across our country.

However the killing of George Floyd was a wake-up call for our nation. The relationship between police and the people they protect is significantly strained in many communities particularly in communities of color.

THREAD: Citizens in every community should feel safe and have confidence in their law enforcement officers. I have always supported our police and the vast majority of them are good people who care deeply about the citizens they serve.

The killing of George Floyd was a wake-up call. America's promise is one of equality and justice for everyone but we haven't always lived up to these very worthy ideals.
